definition: cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery

sentences.english: Too many people live in a prison that they have themselves manufactured.
sentences.chinese: 太多的人自作牢籠，桎梏了自己。

sentences.english: But Shanghai is already gridlocked and smoggy and getting worse by the day.
sentences.chinese: 但是上海已經像一個污煙癉氣的牢籠一樣越變越糟。

sentences.english: Are we the beast in the cage?
sentences.chinese: 而我們難道是在牢籠裏的困獸？

sentences.english: The darkness is a cage , which limited him, since he revived.
sentences.chinese: 那黑暗如牢籠，自他蘇生，就將他禁錮。

sentences.english: You can deny your cage all you want, but the cage is still there.
sentences.chinese: 你可以否認你所向往的牢籠，但它還是在那裏。

sentences.english: Stone walls do not a prison make, nor iron bars a cage;
sentences.chinese: 石頭築不成監獄，鐵柵築不成牢籠。

definition: to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
